subject: Home & DIY
title: Smart Plugs: The Entry Drug
description: A micro-lesson that makes Smart Plugs: The Entry Drug usable.

hook.text: A $15 smart plug makes any dumb appliance smart. Plug in a lamp, fan, or coffee maker and control it by phone.

buildup.text: Smart plugs connect to Wi-Fi for scheduled on/off, energy monitoring, and voice-triggered actions via assistants.

discovery.text: Energy monitoring reveals phantom loadsâ€”devices draining power while 'off.' One plug can find $50/year in waste.

twist.text: Cheap plugs often skip energy monitoring and use insecure firmware. Some send data to servers in foreign countries.

climax.text: Smart plugs start most journeys. One plug leads to a bulb, then a thermostat, then a full smart ecosystem.

punchline.text: Fifteen dollars to start. A smart home to finish.

quiz.question: What hidden benefit do energy-monitoring smart plugs reveal?
options: Phantom loads from devices wasting power while technically off
Which appliances are nearing end of life
The quality of electricity from your utility provider
